qas.question: What two-word phrase is used for the main part of the lungs infected by TB?
If the lungs are infected by TB via bloodstream, what's the type of focus?
In what general area of the lungs is SImon focus usually located?
What is the term that describes a blood-borne infection, like TB when it travels through the blood to the kidneys or brain?
Four areas of the body are usually safe from TB infection, including skeletal muscles, heart, and thyroid; what's the fourth?
What is the section of lung not affected by TB called?
What is another name for Ghon focus?
What is type of transmission is found in the lungs?
Where are the peripheral lymph nodes?
What disease often affects the heart, skeletal muscles, pancreas, or thyroid?

context: The primary site of infection in the lungs, known as the "<a0_0><b5_0>Ghon focus<b5_0/><a0_0/>", is generally located in either the upper part of the lower lobe, or the lower part of the upper lobe. <b9_0>Tuberculosis<b9_0/> of the lungs may also occur via infection from the blood stream. This is known as a <a1_0><b6_0>Simon focus<b6_0/><a1_0/> and is typically found in <a2_0>the top<a2_0/> of the lung. This <a3_0><b7_0>hematogenous<b7_0/><a3_0/> transmission can also spread infection to more distant sites, such as peripheral lymph nodes, <b8_0>the kidneys<b8_0/>, the brain, and the bones. All parts of the body can be affected by the disease, though for unknown reasons it rarely affects the heart, skeletal muscles, <a4_0>pancreas<a4_0/>, or thyroid.
